Flemmi shopped with victim before death

Stephen Flemmi testified today that he distracted 26-year-old alleged "Whitey" Bulger victim Deborah Hussey to make sure she had no idea they were preparing to kill her. Bulger vehemently insists he did not commit the murders of Hussey and the only other female victim, Debra Davis. (12:58 p.m.)

18-story tower planned for Fenway

A development firm has proposed an 18-story complex to replace the Burger King at 1350 Boylston Street with 240 apartments and ground floor retail spaces. (2:48 p.m.)

Massachusetts among top solar states

Solar energy generating capacity in Massachusetts grew by 65 percent last year, making the Commonwealth one of the top states for solar projects. (2:04 p.m.)

Breaching of dam, restoring salmon’s passage unite many

The breach of the Veazie Dam, the culmination of a $62 million public-private partnership, is a critical step toward revitalizing Maine’s Penobscot River.

Conservation program eases power grid strain

The program pays large commercial users to cut their electricity use when consumption begins to approach the grid’s capacity.

Marriage is not just some timeless institution that needs to be preserved. It has evolved over time, differing radically across cultures.

FDA: Plan B only morning-after pill allowed on store shelves

News

LaGuardia fully re-opens

The New York airport reopened both runways this morning after the collapse of a plane's front landing gear sent it skidding along the tarmac and temporarily suspended airport operations. The plane was being moved to a hangar.

Wendy's tops expectations; to sell 425 restaurants to franchisees
